headline: Easy Guacamole
description: This easy guacamole recipe is quick to make and delicious to eat! Try it if you're learning how to make guac or simply need to whip up some to share.

video.description: See how to make classic, quick-and-easy guacamole.
video.name: Easy Guacamole

name: Easy Guacamole

recipeInstructions.text: Mash avocado in a medium serving bowl. Stir in onion, tomato, and garlic. Season with lime juice, salt, and pepper.
Cover and chill guacamole for 30 minutes to allow flavors to blend.

review.reviewBody: Made this to go with crockpot chicken fajitas tonight and it was easy - and delicious!!
Easy to make and everyone loved it!!
Very tasty. Added lemon as I didn't have lime. Some spicy paprika and a little Extra Virgin olive oil. Amazing.
Was delicious! I also sprinkled some Crushed Red Pepper on top for a little spice.
so creamy best guac ever
I love this recipe very much. Thanks for posting.

Absolutely love this! My entire family loves this recipe whenever I make it which is quite often üòÅ The only thing my husband asks is that I put a little cilantro in it that's it. But I almost never do LOL it's perfect the way it is, I love the onions and tomato combination. Great job thanks for sharing!
good and easy
Made it twice and both times an absolute hit, people are calling me the Guacamole King. to funny because it is so easy
So far I've just had a taste - it is in the fridge til dinnertime.
Easy peasy
I followed the instructions exactly as is and the guac received gold star status with my family. My kids thought it was store bought! I will surely save this and use it often.
Just the right amount of ingredients!! Loved it!!
Delicious!

Quick, simple, VERY DELICIOUS! I had brown onion so used half w 3 good sized cloves garlic. Zapped this really quickly w lime juice in nutri bullet. Was sceptical. Added to 2 lovely chunky cut avocados & 1 semi chunky cut more like diced ripe tomato. Healthy sprinkle salt & good dash white pepper. Used fork, stirred her all up & vwala! I surprised myself @ how delicious it turned out. Thank you!! Xxx
Easy and quick. Very tasty!

First time for me making my own guacamole. This recipe is so easy to put together and it is delicious. My husband really liked it too. We had this as a side with our tacos on taco night and there was nothing left when we were done. Thank you for this easy recipe. 5 stars. Loved it. :)
OMG just made this my first time and I love it came out so good will never pay for store bought guacamole again
Best I‚Äôve had. I did add some sour cream, as someone suggested. This will be my go to.
noice
Love it! Probably needed a bit more lime for more zest
I don‚Äôt personally eat guac, but everyone in my family that does says this is the best I‚Äôve made by far.
Loved it. Followed the recipe exactly and won‚Äôt change anything the next time around. My uber picky husband loved it too so this is definitely a keeper.
Very good and easy. But I use a few fresh green onion instead of white onion in the recipe.

This is my "go to" for guacamole. Don't remember where I got the original but this is it. I use about 1/3 of fresh onions. Great recipe and leaves room for other ingredients according to personal taste!!
Great and easy recipe! Tastes wonderful!
Was awsone
Way too much onion for 2 Avocados!!!! Also forget the garlic
Super easy and very flavorful
So simple and fast the hardest part was waiting the 30 minutes for the flavours to marry.
Great simple recipe!! I left out the garlic the first time because I was looking for a quick recipe and read the recipe too fast and missed it. Absolutely loved it!
Very easy and very good. Simple ingredients that I had in the house.
Served this in the shells of the Avocado!! Covid-19 individual servings. .
It turned out so good. Thank u
AMAZING
easy, good.
Excellent! Oh so easy!
Seemed kinda heavy on the garlic. Will do less in the future. Our avocados also weren‚Äôt very ripe so has to add salsa for flavor.

I doubled this to bring to a cabin weekend and everyone chowed it down quickly when serving it with chips. I added more onion and cilantro. It was a huge hit. I prepared everything but the avocado's, in a container the day before and then I added the avocados on the day of serving it. I love lime but I actually cut that in 1/2 and I think it was a good call. Maybe next time add a little more fresh lime juice.
I think I over did with cilantro which is why I gave it 3 stars.
I ate every bit of it!!! So delicious!!!

First time making Guacamole and it was super easy as the recipe title boasts. I did add a little bit of vinegar as one of the other reviewers suggested. It was really delicious and one that my husband enjoyed taste testing for me.
The best easy guacamole recipe

Great recipe, very easy to adjust to personal taste preferences!

I hate raw onion so I substituted 1/4 teaspoon onion powder.

Absolutely delicious!
YUM!!!! I did half of an onion. It rocked! I could eat this for days.
Very easy and delicious recipe
Easy and delicious
I used salsa, instead of tomatoes and a dollop of sour cream, came out great.

Excellent quick recipe! You can always dial down a bit on the onion if onions aren‚Äôt your thing but overall very flavorful for those who aren‚Äôt into spicy or can‚Äôt have spicy guac. My family loved it.
I like this recipe. But the proportions are all wrong. And the recipe needs a little kick. I had to had an ingredient that I will leave a secret. It also needed more or less of things.
decent recipe..will try it again after a few variations

I was very lazy and trying not to cut a fresh onion, so I improvised/cheated a bit. I substituted onion powder, minced garlic, salsa and reconstituted lime juice for their fresh counterparts and threw in a bit of chili powder as well. Thanks for the recipe and inspiration: it was my first time making guacamole, but it definitely won‚Äôt be the last!
Excellent and very easy
Yummy! I‚Äôd like more tomato and lime in mine next time! It sure hit the spot!!!
It was very easy and tasted great! Put a little less onion in. Definitely will make it again!
Perfect quac!

This was excellent. I used all the lime juice listed in the recipe and thought it enhanced it but wasn't overpowering. I had a bunch of fresh cilantro and threw that in. My daughter always orders the tableside made guacamole at our favorite Mexican restaurant and she thought it just as delicious. Thank you!
Made it just as written. Easy to make and fast.
Super easy. Did't really measure things and only had one big avacado so cut recipe in half . Turned out great.
I used a little bit to much onion, that being said it was pretty good.., I also added sour cream, celery salt & Worcestershire...
I made it just like the recipe. I don‚Äôt eat guacamole but hubby loves it so I thought I would give it a try. He said it‚Äôs perfect!
Followed the recipe very closely, but added a couple of squeezes of tube cilantro. This was really good!
A very easy and tasty recipe. Thanks!
Best guacamole I have ever made. It disappeared quickly.
Easy, and so good. Put in salt at end, and add until you like the taste.
I did not add tomatoes because I didn‚Äôt have some on hand. But it still tasted great!
I've made this twice now and brought to different events. I've been told to please "bring it again"!
Excellent
Quick, easy and was enjoyed by all!

Never made guacamole before.
Super fast and easy.
Delicious!
Great disaster-proof recipe! Didn't have any tortilla chips so I ate it with saltine crackers, but it still tasted wonderful. My family demolished it within seconds!
I made this. I found that the ratio of ingredients was off. Luckily, I had two extra avocados, so I used 4 avocados to balance out the onion, etc. It turned out really well!
I added some raisins, & got raves! Will be my go-to recipe!
used diced tomatoes and green chiles instead of tomato
I loved i and very easy
It's great! It stores in the refrigerator with a lid overnight without turning brown.
It‚Äôs decent but it was a bit bland for me, second batch I added some jalape√±os to give it a small kick.
My family loves this!
A great basic recipe that serves as a starting point. Easy to embellish with your own twist. Yummy!!

Good recipe, but I would use only half the amount of onion recommended (otherwise it overpowers the taste), a half lime instead of whole (especially with only two avocados!) and a pinch of cayenne pepper to add a little "punch." Also, to avoid browning, press some plastic wrap onto the top of the guacamole before you put the top on your container. Some people use a little extra lime juice on top - which works - but I think that the plastic wrap works better. It's all about avoiding exposure to oxygen until you are ready to serve.

Good recipe, but I would use only half the amount of onion recommended (otherwise it overpowers the taste), a half lime instead of whole (especially with only two avocados!) and a pinch of cayenne pepper to add a little "punch." Also, to avoid browning, press some plastic wrap onto the top of the guacamole before you put the top on your container. Some people use a little extra lime juice on top - which works - but I think that the plastic wrap works better. It's all about avoiding exposure to oxygen until you are ready to serve.
I would definitely make this again!! This brought back the Mexican in me. Thanks to the maker this saved my grades in school!! SOOOO GOOD!!!
I didn‚Äôt have tomatoes at the time so I used salsa instead and it tasted super good.
Great simple recipe. I wasn't exact with the measurements and used dried chopped onions rather than a fresh onion, but it turned our really delicious.
I added a little chilli powder and extra lime juice

I used 3 avocados, I added a little raw elephant garlic and plenty of lime juice, fresh lightly spicy peppers and on serving, left the seed in middle of dish. It looked special and I believe it keeps the guacamole from turning colors so fast. I probably won‚Äôt buy store bought guacamole again. Sooo good!
Great Recipe! was very delicious and easy to make. We ate it with homemade tortilla chips.
dudnt like it eaither to much lime or onoin or garlic something wasnt right...i ended up throwing it away
I will definitely make this again.

My first attempt at quac (my brother has been making it for years, swears his is the best). We both took a batch to the Super Bowl party, mine was gone rather quickly, he took some of his home! Sibling rivalry at its best.
Make sure avocado isn‚Äôt over ripe or the guacamole won‚Äôt last. I used lemon instead of lime, and tomato paste instead of tomato...don‚Äôt recommend these substitutes!
This was simple and tasted great. I didn't have lime, so used lemon juice. Still lovely flavour.
Worked out we'll. Was the hit of t he party.
Excellent 1st time recipe, very simple.
Everyone loves it
Yummy!!
Our favorite guacamole recipe!
good and easy recipe. made in it minutes. had all ingredients on hand in pantry or frig already. no extravagant stuff needed.
Wonderful recipe. Best guacamole I have ever eaten. Made for family during holidays and they couldn't enough.
